title: I am not an avid non-fiction reader. How do I change that about myself? - Quora

response.answer_text: Part of it for me was realizing I became a small thumbnail of the author for each book I read. As my work week would go on and I would get further into the book, things would start coming out in my communication and attitude where I was asking myself, “Where did that come from?” I started to look forward to those moments more and more. Second, try reading non fiction slowly over a long period of time, even just two pages at a time. I now always have a non fiction book in the bathroom with me, for example. It’s just enough time to “push thru” a few pages (sorry for the pun but it was there).

Are there famous people that you’re interested in? Are there periods in history that you’re interested in? Do you have questions about current events? There will be books that you could read to at least get started on your journey into non-fiction. Once you get started, you’ll most likely find even more areas that arouse interest. Happy hunting!
